query: How does the detection of upper main sequence stars and red giant branch stars in the halo of an amorphous galaxy relate to previous work on galaxy interactions and distance measurements?

citation_function_classification.justification: The query references foundational observational methods (star detection) and implicitly asks why these findings matter in the context of prior research on galaxy interactions and measurement techniques, highlighting motivation.
